dialog.eventText: Wading through the dense swamplands, you encounter an odd pool of water. It is murky, tainted with thin strands of blue. A vague urge calls for you to sit down and drink from it.

The urge overwhelms you. You scoop your hands into the pool, bringing the murky blue substance to your mouth to drink. You let out a slight moan before repeating the process over and over, finding the liquid to be irresistibly good. With every gulp you feel a slight tingling in your thighs and pressure begins to build up. But you find yourself unable to care. Eventually the trance subsides, and you blink at your surroundings. Everything seems the same, except for the fact that your lower body feels strangely heavier.

Perhaps the blue water is responsible?

Why on Earth should you drink from a random puddle on the ground? It's likely contaminated with something. Snorting, you turn and walk, feeling the strange tug on your mind fading away with each step, until it's completely gone.
